lead_paragraph: Kendall Coyne scored on a power-play goal 6 minutes 47 seconds into overtime as the United States won the world women’s under-18 hockey championship, defeating Canada, 3-2, in Fussen, Germany. Goaltender Alex Rigsby made 38 saves for the United States, which finished the tournament 4-1-0-0 to successfully defend its title. Brittany Ammerman and Taylor Wasylk also scored for the United States.
